News.Title: NFL Board Meet on Feb 13 for Q3FY26 Results
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited has scheduled a board meeting on February 13, 2026, to consider and approve unaudited financial results for Q3FY26 ended December 31, 2025.

News.Title: NFL Appoints Anurag Rohatgi as Additional Director
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited announces appointment of Shri Anurag Rohatgi as Additional Director (Government Nominee) effective December 19, 2025, replacing Shri Bharat Bhushan on the company board.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Reports Loss in Q2 FY26 Despite Subsidy Income Boost
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited reported a standalone net loss of Rs 10.21 crore for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, compared to a loss of Rs 40.84 crore in the previous quarter. The company recognized subsidy income of Rs 901.40 crore for the quarter and Rs 926.89 crore for the half-year on DAP & TSP fertilizers based on operational guidelines from the Department of Fertilizers for Kharif 2025. For the half-year period, the standalone net loss was Rs 42.34 crore versus Rs 61.97 crore loss in the same period last year. The consolidated results showed a net loss of Rs 5.80 crore for the quarter and Rs 75.25 crore for the half-year. The company's Board approved a final dividend of Rs 1.56 per share for FY 2024-25, which was paid in October 2025. National Fertilizers also entered into a joint venture agreement for Assam Valley Fertilizer and Chemical Company Limited with an 18% equity holding.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Announces ₹5.72 Billion Investment in Assam Valley Fertilizer for Ammonia-Urea Facility
News.Summary: National Fertilizers has announced a ₹5.72 billion investment in Assam Valley Fertilizer for an ammonia-urea facility. The investment will support the development of fertilizer manufacturing infrastructure.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Reports Narrower Q2 Loss Despite Lower Margins
News.Summary: National Fertilizers reported a net loss of 102 million rupees in Q2, an improvement from the 106 million rupee loss in the same period last year. Revenue surged to 67.6 billion rupees compared to 43.9 billion rupees year-over-year. EBITDA increased to 1.28 billion rupees from 1.2 billion rupees, though EBITDA margin declined to 1.90% from 2.76% in the previous year.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Limited Promotes Vinay Kumar Gupta to Executive Director
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited announced the promotion of Vinay Kumar Gupta from Chief General Manager (Vijaipur Unit) to Executive Director on November 7, 2025. Gupta is a Mechanical Engineer from Malaviya National Institute of Technology, Jaipur, with 35 years of experience at NFL. His expertise includes handling operations, maintenance, and management of large fertilizer complexes, and he has successfully executed major turnarounds of fertilizer plants. He led the Energy Saving Project (ESP-II) at NFL Vijaipur and played a key role during the COVID-19 pandemic in revamping the synthesis compressor drive turbine at NFL Vijaipur through remote online monitoring from Mitsubishi, Japan.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Limited Appoints New Director (Technical)
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited announced board changes with Shri Megh Nath Goyal appointed as Director (Technical) effective November 5, 2025. Ms. Ritu Goswami ceased from her position as Director (Technical) - Additional Charge on the same date. Goyal, a Mechanical Engineer with a Masters degree from University of Roorkee, brings 33 years of experience in process plant maintenance, process management and project execution across various NFL plants. He previously served as Executive Director (Nangal Unit Head) at NFL's Nangal Unit. His appointment is valid until his superannuation on May 31, 2027, or until further orders, whichever is earlier.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Receives ₹15.23 Crore Tax Demand Notice
News.Summary: National Fertilizers has received a demand notice from the Deputy Commissioner of Commercial Taxes for ₹15.23 crores. The notice pertains to commercial tax obligations.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Receives ₹116.01 Crore Tax Refund Recovery and Penalty Order
News.Summary: National Fertilizers has received a ₹116.01 crore refund recovery claim and penalty order from the Central Tax Department.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Receives ₹116.01 Crore Refund Recovery Order and Penalty from Central Tax Department
News.Summary: National Fertilizers has received a ₹116.01 crore refund recovery order and penalty from the Central Tax Department. The company is subject to this tax-related action involving both recovery and penalty components.

News.Title: Proposal Suggests Reducing GST On Fertilizers From 18% To 5%
News.Summary: A proposal has been made to lower the Goods and Services Tax (GST) rate on fertilizers from the current 18% to 5%. This tax reduction proposal relates to NFL (National Fertilizers Limited) and the fertilizer sector.

News.Title: China Lifts Trade Restrictions on Fertilizers, Rare Earths, and Tunnel Boring Machines for India
News.Summary: China has removed restrictions on the export of fertilizers, rare earths, and tunnel boring machines to India. This development affects trade relations between the two countries in these specific sectors.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Reports Mixed Q1 Results with Revenue Decline and Reduced Losses
News.Summary: National Fertilizers reported Q1 EBITDA of 886 million rupees, down from 1.1 billion rupees year-over-year. However, EBITDA margin improved to 2.51% from 2.15% in the same period last year. The company posted a net loss of 321 million rupees, which was lower than the previous year's loss of 413 million rupees. Revenue declined significantly to 35 billion rupees from 50.9 billion rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: China Eases Urea Export Restrictions to India Amid Improving Relations
News.Summary: China has relaxed its urea export policies toward India as diplomatic tensions between the two countries show signs of improvement. This development affects NFL (National Fertilizers Limited) and could impact India's fertilizer supply chain and agricultural sector.

News.Title: NFL Schedules Board Meeting to Review Quarterly Results
News.Summary: NFL has announced that the company will consider its quarterly results on August 14. The board meeting is scheduled to review the financial performance for the quarter.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Limited Promotes B.B. Grover to Executive Director
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited promoted Shri B.B. Grover from Chief General Manager (Technical Services) to Executive Director (TS) effective August 1, 2025. Grover is a graduate in Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering from Thapar Institute and holds an MBA in Human Resources. He has over 36 years of experience in the fertilizer industry, joining NFL as a Management Trainee in 1988. During his career, he contributed to key projects including transition of ammonia feedstock from fuel oil to natural gas, commissioning of Gas Turbine Generator systems, and implementation of Distributed Control Systems. As Unit Head of the Panipat facility, he implemented systemic changes that resulted in sustained and efficient operations.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Limited Executive Director Shri Sudhir Kumar Jha Retires
News.Summary: Shri Sudhir Kumar Jha, Executive Director of Panipat Unit at National Fertilizers Limited (NFL), has retired from service upon reaching the age of superannuation on July 31, 2025. The company notified stock exchanges NSE and BSE about this senior management change. NFL is a Navratna company with its corporate office in Noida and registered office in New Delhi.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Limited Forms Joint Venture to Set Up New Ammonia-Urea Plant in Assam
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited has entered into a joint venture agreement with the Government of Assam, Oil India Limited, Hindustan Urvarak & Rasayan Limited, and Brahmaputra Valley Fertilizer Corporation Limited. The joint venture company, Assam Valley Fertilizer And Chemical Company Limited, was incorporated on July 25, 2025, to establish a new Ammonia-Urea Complex Namrup IV Fertilizer Plant in Namrup, Assam. NFL holds an 18% stake in the joint venture with an investment of Rs. 1.8 lakh for 18,000 equity shares. The shareholding structure is 40:18:18:13:11 among the partners. The project has a tentative completion timeline of 48 months from the zero date and requires approval from the Department of Fertilizers, Ministry of Chemicals and Fertilizers.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Limited Appoints Ms. Ritu Goswami as Additional Director (Technical)
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited announced that Ms. Ritu Goswami has been assigned additional charge as Director (Technical) on the company's Board effective July 22, 2025. Goswami currently serves as Director (Technical) at Rashtriya Chemicals & Fertilizers Limited. The appointment was made through an order from the Department of Fertilizers, Government of India, for a term of six months or until a regular incumbent assumes charge. Goswami is a Chemical Engineer with over 35 years of experience in the fertilizer industry, with expertise in project conceptualization, technology selection, business strategies, and production planning. She has previously worked on major fertilizer projects at Gorakhpur, Sindri and Barauni while on deputation as fertilizer expert in HURL.

News.Title: NFL Receives GST Refund Recovery Notice for ₹116.01 Crores
News.Summary: The National Fertilizers Limited (NFL) has received a notice for GST refund recovery totaling ₹116.01 crores for the period from April 2022 to March 2023. The notice pertains to the recovery of GST refunds previously granted to the company.

News.Title: DIPAM Seeks New Bids for NFL Offer For Sale
News.Summary: The Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) has requested new bids for an Offer For Sale (OFS) of National Fertilizers Limited (NFL). No specific details about the size of the offer, timeline, or reasons for seeking new bids were provided in the given news snippet.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Reports Q4 Financial Results
News.Summary: National Fertilizers has reported its Q4 financial results. The company's EBITDA decreased to 2.3 billion rupees from 3.82 billion rupees year-over-year. The EBITDA margin fell to 5.26% from 7.23% in the same period last year. Net profit for Q4 was 973 million rupees, down from 1.82 billion rupees year-over-year, but up from 309 million rupees quarter-on-quarter. Revenue for Q4 was 44.6 billion rupees, compared to 52.84 billion rupees in the same quarter last year.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Receives Tax Demand Orders Totaling 3.84 Billion Rupees
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited has received two tax demand orders from tax authorities. The first order is for 1.94 billion rupees, and the second is for 1.9 billion rupees, totaling approximately 3.84 billion rupees in tax demands.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Receives Tax Demand Orders
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited has received two tax demand orders totaling approximately 3.84 billion rupees. The first order is for 1.94 billion rupees, and the second is for 1.9 billion rupees.

News.Title: National Fertilizers to Join Joint Venture for New Ammonia-Urea Complex in Assam
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited (NFL) has announced its participation in a joint venture with an 18% equity stake. The joint venture aims to establish a new ammonia-urea complex in Namrup, Assam. This strategic move is expected to enhance NFL's production capacity and strengthen its presence in the fertilizer industry in Northeast India.

News.Title: National Fertilizers to Join Joint Venture for New Fertilizer Plant in Assam
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited is set to participate in a joint venture with an 18% equity stake. The joint venture will establish a new ammonia-urea complex in Namrup, Assam. This strategic move aims to expand the company's production capacity and strengthen its presence in the fertilizer sector in Northeast India.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Reports Decline in Q3 Profit and Revenue
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited has reported a significant decrease in both net profit and revenue for the third quarter. The company's net profit fell to 309 million rupees from 1.40 billion rupees in the same period last year. Revenue also declined to 58.56 billion rupees from 75.81 billion rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Limited: Q3 Profit Plunges 70%, Revenue Down 23%
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited reported a 70% decrease in net profit to ₹458 crore for Q3. The company's revenue also declined by 23% during the same period.

News.Title: National Fertilizers to Produce Nano Urea at Nangal Plant
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited has announced plans to manufacture high-tech nano urea at its Nangal plant. This move signifies the company's entry into advanced fertilizer technology, potentially improving agricultural efficiency and crop yields.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Reports Significant Q2 EBITDA Improvement
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited has reported a substantial improvement in its Q2 EBITDA, turning a loss of 589 million rupees in the previous year into a gain of 1.24 billion rupees. The company's Q2 EBITDA margin stands at 2.85%.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Reports Q2 Revenue Decline
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited has reported its second quarter revenue for the current fiscal year. The company's revenue stood at 43.9 billion rupees, showing a significant decrease from 56.5 billion rupees in the same quarter of the previous year.

News.Title: National Fertilizers Reports Q2 Net Loss
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited has reported a net loss of 1.6 million rupees for the second quarter. This represents an improvement from the loss of 1.13 billion rupees in the same quarter last year (YoY). However, it's a decline from the previous quarter (QoQ), where the loss was 413 million rupees.

News.Title: National Fertilizers: PSU Reports ₹12 Crore Q2 Profit
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited, a public sector undertaking, has reported a profit of ₹12 crore for the second quarter of the current fiscal year.

News.Title: National Fertilizers to Set Up Water Soluble Fertilizers Plant
News.Summary: National Fertilizers Limited's board has approved the establishment of a Water Soluble Fertilizers (WSF) and Micro Nutrients (MN) production plant at their Vijaipur facility. The estimated project capital cost is Rs 208 crore.
